content.rendered:
Overview

Trademark registration shields your brand and gives you the tools to restrict others from utilizing similar signs and riding on the back of your business. Trademark means a sign capable of being represented graphically and which is proficient in identifying the goods or services of one person from those of others and may comprise an appearance of goods, their packaging, also a combination of colors. Trademark registration in India is desirable to guard your brand.

Our Process

Step 1

Discussion & collecting required documents

Step 2

Take a search and finalize class

Step 3

Submit documents

Step 4

Application for trademark Registration

Step 5

Start using “TM”

Choose Your Package

All Inclusive Pricing – No Hidden Fee

  • Basic
    • ₹ 6000
      • Trademark filing under one class for proprietorship and small enterprises.
    • Purchase Now
  • Premium
    • ₹ 6500
      • Trademark filing under one class for proprietorship and small enterprises.
      • 1 Reply for objection
    • Purchase Now
  • Ultimate
    • ₹ 11500
      • Trademark filing under one class for large enterprises not eligible of MSME registration.
      • 1 Reply for objection
    • Purchase Now

Benefits

Trademarks prevent your brand and goodwill, products, and services. They provide uniqueness to your brand.

They are precious assets and it keeps appreciating over time.

It makes it simple for clients to find you. They establish a brand aside from the crowd.

Trademarks support organizations to efficiently use the power of the Internet and social media.

Documents Required

Name of Applicant

Type of Business

Main Activities of Business

Name of Brand/Logo

Address

Clear All Your Doubts !

Should the trademark be filed in the individual’s name or companies name?

Many start-ups register a Trademark based on the founder’s name, whereas large businesses prefer to do so in the name of the company. This is because the future of a start-up is always in doubt. If owned by the founder, the trademark would be valid regardless of the state of the entity.

What cannot be registered as a trademark?

Any mark that is identical or deceptively similar to an existing registered trademark, or a trademark for which the application for registration is already in process, such trademarks cannot be registered. Also, a mark that would likely cause deception or confusion, or that appears offensive may not be registered. Geographical names, common names, common trade words, and common abbreviations are also not registrable.

Once registered for what period, a trademark is effective? Can a trademark registration be renewed?

The registered trademark is valid for a period of 10 years from the date of application registration. It can be renewed every 10 years, perpetually. In India, a renewal request is to be filed within six months before the expiry of the last registration of a trademark.

How long does it take for the trademark to get registered?

Usually, it takes at least 15 to 18 months for Trademark registration in India once applied. Post which the owner can use (R) symbol beside the Trademark. However, as soon as the online Trademark Application is filed, the applicant can start using the (TM) symbol. The registration may get delayed due to the verification procedure.

What is trademark class? How to find an appropriate class?

Controller General of Patents, Designs, and Trademarks has classified goods and services under 45 classes. Your application must mention the class/classes that the goods/services represent. The trademarks are registered only under those classes. Our experts will help you to find applicable and related classes. For each class, a separate application is filed by paying the prescribed Government fee.

Will the trademark be valid outside India?

The registration application filed under the Trademark Act, 1999 is verified and registered in India and it remains valid only in India.

How does my start-up qualify for a 50% rebate on the Government fee?

If you have a valid certificate issued by Start-up India (an initiative by the Government of India), your start-up gets qualified to avail 50% rebate on Government fees for brand-name registration.

Let’s start your business journey with Book My Consultant.

Interested
